critique: This document is an executive order by President Roosevelt approving a Code of Fair Competition for the Dress Manufacturing Industry under the National Industrial Recovery Act. It reflects a strong interventionist approach to the economy, typical of the New Deal era. The order also demonstrates a centralization of power in the federal government, as it imposes regulations on a specific industry nationwide. There is no clear indication of bias regarding immigration, national security, or social inclusion. The document does not explicitly expand executive power, but it does utilize existing executive authority granted by the NIRA. The document seems to have a slight ideological tilt towards liberal because of the economic intervention.
